page.title: 16RECREATION - BURGHFIELD
page.content: Burghfield Sailing Club moved to Theale Water in 1977. It was formerly Burghfield Lake Sailing Club and used gravel pits at Pingewood. The land is rented from A.R.C. and consists of roughly three acres of grassland and two hundred acres of water. The clubhouse comprises a clubroom, changing rooms, kitchen and bar. The porta cabin on the site is used by the Berkshire Schools Sail Training Scheme and the additional boathouse is used to store rescue boats and equipment. There are two jetties - one floating and the other made of scaffolding and wood. The boat park is roughly two acres in area, there is an acre of grass for spectators and a half an acre of car parking space. There are about 1000 members, 60% of whom sail dinghies such as Lasers, Solos and Enterprises: others use sailboards.
